title: datalad download-url --path does not work without backslash
body:
When following this documentation <http://docs.datalad.org/projects/hirni/en/latest/demos/demo_reproducibility.html#a-reproducible-glm-demo-analysis>, the step `download-url` does not work when using `--path` without a backslash.

```console
$ datalad create glm_analysis
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/datalad-tests/glm_analysis
[INFO   ] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time)
create(ok): /tmp/datalad-tests/glm_analysis (dataset)
$ cd glm_analysis
$ datalad run-procedure cfg_yoda
[INFO   ] Running procedure cfg_yoda
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) =====
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) =====
$ datalad download-url --path code https://raw.githubusercontent.com/myyoda/ohbm2018-training/master/section23/scripts/events2ev3.sh
download_url(error): /tmp/datalad-tests/glm_analysis/code (file) [Non-directory path given (no trailing separator) but a directory with that name (after adding archive suffix) exists]
```
But with backslash it works:
```console
$ datalad download-url --path code/ https://raw.githubusercontent.com/myyoda/ohbm2018-training/master/section23/scripts/events2ev3.sh
[INFO   ] Downloading 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/myyoda/ohbm2018-training/master/section23/scripts/events2ev3.sh' into '/tmp/datalad-tests/glm_analysis/code/'
download_url(ok): /tmp/datalad-tests/glm_analysis/code/events2ev3.sh (file)
add(ok): code/events2ev3.sh (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  download_url (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
```

Besides that the documentation is wrong, from a user's perspective this is confusing because it behaves differently than standard commands, e.g. `cp`:

datalad behaviour:

|| `--path code/` | `--path code` |
|:--|:--|:--|
| code dir exists | download `events2ev3.sh` into code | error |
| code dir does not exist | error | download `events2ev3.sh` and name it code |

cp behaviour:
|| `cp events2ev3.sh code/` | `cp events2ev3.sh code` |
| :-- | :-- | :-- |
| code dir exists | copy `events2ev3.sh` into code | copy `events2ev3.sh` into code |
| code dir does not exist | error | copy `events2ev3.sh` and name it code|

I am using datalad version 0.14.0 with python 3.8.7
